Method Detail

getParameterNames

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getParameterNames(java.lang.String sql)
Gets an ArrayList that contains the parameters that are found in the specified SQL string.
The position of each parameter in the list is the same as its occurence in the SQL statement. Each parameters occurs in the list as many times as it is found in the SQL string. Parameters are strings starting with colon (:).

Parameters:
sql - String being parsed.
Returns:
Returns a list with the names of the parameters found in the specified SQL string.

namesToParametersList

public static java.util.List<Parameter> namesToParametersList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> parmNames)
Creates an ArrayList Parameter objects from an ArrayList of parameter names.
Each parameter occurs in the same position as its name in the parmNames ArrayList

Parameters:
parmNames - ArrayList with parameter names.
Returns:
Returns a list of parameter objects.

toString

Parameters:
object -
Returns:

Parameters:

Returns:

Parameters:

Returns:

createInFromCollection

public static java.lang.String createInFromCollection(java.util.Collection<?> col,
                                                      java.lang.String column,
                                                      boolean isNot,
                                                      boolean addEnd)
This function gets a collection and creates and in or not in sql statement.
E.g. from the set {1,2,3} will create the statement "in (1,2,3)"

Parameters:
col - Collection to
column - the database column name.
isNot - create "not in" instead of "in".
addEnd - include "add" in the String.
Returns:
the formatted String to be added to the sql.
